snippet: The toughest fighting was in the northern Iraqi city of Tikrit, where residents said an intense bombing campaign by the Iraqi Army was underway in an effort to retake the city center.
abstract: Almost 200 Sunni militants are killed in battles with Iraqi Army; Islamic State in Iraq and Syria gains potentially significant economic ground in struggle for leverage in region by taking control of Syria's largest oil field; militants also make good on agreement with Turkish government and release 32 Turkish truck drivers.
lead_paragraph: The toughest fighting was in the northern Iraqi city of Tikrit, where residents said an intense bombing campaign by the Iraqi Army was underway in an effort to retake the city center.

headline.main: Scores of Militants Reported Killed by Iraqi Army, but Group Seizes Syrian Oil Field
headline.print_headline: Scores of Militants Reported Killed by Iraqi Army, but Group Seizes Syrian Oil Field

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
